text: Acinos arvensis, known commonly as basil thyme and spring savory, is a species of plant of the genus Acinos. It is a perennial that usually grows about high and spreads . It prefers to grow in strong sunlight. The scent is faintly reminiscent of thyme, giving it its common name. Acinos arvensis is recorded as a food plant for the larva of the moth Coleophora tricolor. This plant is classified by Rose (The Wildflower Key, revised 2006) as Clinopodium acinos. ==References== Category:Lamiaceae Category:Flora of Europe Category:Flora of temperate Asia Category:Taxa named by Jean-Baptiste Lamarck Category:Plants described in 1779
title: Acinos arvensis
